page.title: 01GENERAL
page.content: Our area has three villages, Moulton, Gazeley and Kentford. Each of the villages has a church. The Moulton Church dates back to Norman times. The River Kennet runs through our area, which is quite hilly and the highest point is 92 feet above sea level. There are schools in both Moulton and Gazeley. There are quite a few small businesses moving into the area. Most of the roads are country lanes and there isn't much traffic except on the new A45 by-pass which since 1975 has restored Kentford's peace and quiet. As we are near Newmarket there are a lot of studs because of the horse racing industry. Some interesting places to visit are, the Packhorse Bridge, and a boy's grave which is mentioned on page 14. Most of the landcover is farmland and woodland. On the whole we think our area is a very pleasant place to live.
